melting.sequences
Class NucleotidSequences

java.lang.Object
  melting.sequences.NucleotidSequences

public class NucleotidSequences
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a pair of nucleic acid sequences. It encodes and decodes them, recognizes patterns and provides general purpose sequence manipulation methods. The instance variables are : ArrayList duplex : an ArrayList containing the sorted BasePair objects. String sequence : the sequence (5'3') represented by a String. String complementary : the complementary sequence (3'5') represented by a String. NucleotidSequences rnaEquivalent : the NucleotidSequences object which represents this NucleotidSequences object with RNA sequences NucleotidSequences dnaEquivalent : the NucleotidSequences object which represents this NucleotidSequences object with DNA sequences HashMap modifiedAcidNames : a Map which makes a link between the encoded specific nucleic acid in the String and the matching SpecificAcidNames enum value.

          Creates a NucleotidSequences object from two String.

Method Detail

getEquivalentSequences

public NucleotidSequences getEquivalentSequences(java.lang.String hybridizationType)
This method is called when the same NucleotidSequences is required but with the sequences converted in the new hybridization type "hybridizationType"

Parameters:
String - hybridizationType : the new hybridization type of the sequences
Returns:
the initialised object rnaEquivalent if the hybridization type is "rna" or the initialised object dnaEquivalent if the hybridization type is "dna". If the String hybridization is neither "dna" nor "rna", a SequenceException is thrown.

Parameters:
String - sequence : the sequence (5'3')
String - complementary : the complementary sequence (3'5')
Returns:
a String [] object which contains the encoded String sequence and complementary of the NucleotidSequences object

                                           java.lang.String complementary)
removes the unnecessary "-" in the String sequence and complementary of the NucleotidSequences object

Parameters:
String - sequence : the sequence (5'3')
String - complementary : the complementary sequence (3'5')
Returns:
a String [] object which contains the String sequence and complementary without unnecessary gaps ("-")

getComplementaryTo

public java.lang.String getComplementaryTo(java.lang.String sequence,
                                           int pos1,
                                           int pos2)
This method is called to get the complementary sequence to the sequence String between the positions pos1 and pos2.

Parameters:
String - sequence : substring of one of the sequences (sequence 5'3' or the complementary 3'5')
int - pos1 : starting position of the subsequence in the duplex
int - pos2 : ending position of the subsequence in the duplex
Returns:
the substring between pos1 and pos2 which is the complementary to the sequence String. If the sequence String is neither a substring of the sequence String of NucleotidSequences object, nor a substring of the complementary String of NucleotidSequences object, a SequenceException is thrown.

getSequenceContainig

public java.lang.String getSequenceContainig(java.lang.String pattern,
                                             int pos1,
                                             int pos2)
this method is called to get the String sequence or complementary of the NucleotidSequences object which contains the pattern "pattern".

Parameters:
String - pattern
int - pos1 : starting position of the pattern in the duplex
int - pos2 : ending position of the pattern in the duplex
Returns:
the complementary String or the sequence String, depending on which of them contains the pattern "pattern" between the positions pos1 and pos2. It returns null if neither the sequence String, nor the complementary String contains the pattern "pattern" between pos1 and pos2.

isCNGPattern

public boolean isCNGPattern(int pos1,
                            int pos2)
to check if the pattern between the positions pos1 and pos2 in the duplex is a CNG repeat pattern. A CNG repeat pattern is when the total sequence String is G(CNG)xC where N is a mismatch (N,N) and x is the number of CNG repeats in the sequence String.

Parameters:
int - pos1 : starting position of the pattern in the duplex
int - pos2 : ending position of the pattern in the duplex
Returns:
true if the pattern between the positions pos1 and pos2 in the duplex is a CNG repeat pattern.

isPerfectMatchSequence

public boolean isPerfectMatchSequence(int pos1,
                                      int pos2)
to check to check if the sequences between the positions pos1 and pos2 in the duplex are perfectly matching sequences. Two sequences are perfectly matching sequences when all the nucleic acids of each strand are paired with their complementary base pair.

Parameters:
int - pos1 : starting position of the pattern in the duplex
int - pos2 : ending position of the pattern in the duplex
Returns:
true if the sequences between the positions pos1 and pos2 are perfectly matching sequences.

isDanglingEnd

public boolean isDanglingEnd(int pos1,
                             int pos2)
to check if there is at least one dangling end between the positions pos1 and pos2 in the duplex. A dangling end is when a terminal nucleic acid is un paired.

Parameters:
int - pos1 : starting position of the pattern in the duplex
int - pos2 : ending position of the pattern in the duplex
Returns:
true if there is at least one dangling end between the positions pos1 and pos2 in the duplex

isGUSequences

public boolean isGUSequences(int pos1,
                             int pos2)
to check if the pattern between the positions pos1 and pos2 in the duplex is only composed of GU base pairs.

Parameters:
int - pos1 : starting position of the pattern in the duplex
int - pos2 : ending position of the pattern in the duplex
Returns:
true if the pattern between the positions pos1 and pos2 in the duplex is only composed of GU base pairs.

isMismatchPair

public boolean isMismatchPair(int pos)
to check if the base pair at the position pos in the duplex is a mismatch. A mismatch is when the bases int the base pair (A, T, G, C or U) are not complementary base pairs.

Parameters:
int - pos : the position of the base pair to test in the duplex ArrayList
Returns:
true if the base pair at the positions pos in the duplex is a mismatch.

isMismatch

public boolean isMismatch(int pos1,
                          int pos2)
to check if the pattern between the positions pos1 and pos2 in the duplex is a single mismatch, tandem mismatch or internal loop. There is an internal loop when all the base pairs in the duplex are not complementary. if there are gaps in the sequences, if no one of the sequences is only composed of gaps (-) between the positions pos1 and pos2 in the duplex, there is also an internal loop (but asymmetric).

Parameters:
int - pos1 : starting position of the pattern in the duplex
int - pos2 : ending position of the pattern in the duplex
Returns:
true if the pattern between the positions pos1 and pos2 in the duplex is a single mismatch, a tandem mismatch or an internal loop. Ex : (A, G) is a single mismatch (AC, CC) is a tandem mismatch (ACGTGC, CCTCAT) is a symmetric internal loop (ACGTGC, CC-CAT) is an asymmetric internal loop

isBulgeLoop

public boolean isBulgeLoop(int pos1,
                           int pos2)
to check if the pattern between the positions pos1 and pos2 in the duplex is a single or long bulge loop. There is an bulge loop when one of the strands is only composed of gaps (-) between the positions pos1 and pos2 int the duplex.

Parameters:
int - pos1 : starting position of the pattern in the duplex
int - pos2 : ending position of the pattern in the duplex
Returns:
true if the pattern between the positions pos1 and pos2 in the duplex is a single or long bulge loop. Ex : (T, -) is a single bulge loop (this base pair is not a terminal base pair, otherwise it is a dangling end) (ACT, ---) is a long bulge loop

isRegisteredNucleicAcid

public boolean isRegisteredNucleicAcid(int pos)
to check if the nucleic acids of the base pair at the position pos in the duplex are existing nucleic acids. (exist in the existingNucleicAcids ArrayList of the BasePair class)

Parameters:
int - pos : position of the nucleic acid in the duplex
Returns:
true if the two nucleic acids are known by MELTING.

Parameters:
BasePair - pair
Returns:
the SpecificAcidNames enum which represents the name of the specific nucleic acid in the base pair.

isAPyrimidineInThePosition

public boolean isAPyrimidineInThePosition(int pos)
to check if there is at least one pyrimidine in the base pair at the position pos of the duplex ArrayList.

Parameters:
int - pos : position of the base pair in the duplex
Returns:
true if the TopAcid String is a pyrimidine ("C", "T" or "U") or if the BottomAcid String is a pyrimidine.

public boolean isTandemMismatchGGPenaltyNecessary(int pos)
To check if there is a GG base pair adjacent to a AA base pair or a base pair containing a pyrimidine ("C", "T" or "U").

Parameters:
int - pos : position of the Crick' pair in the duplex
Returns:
true if there is a GG base pair adjacent to a AA base pair or a base pair containing a pyrimidine ("C", "T" or "U").

Parameters:
int - pos : positions of the Crick's pair in the duplex
Returns:
true if there is an AG or GA base pair adjacent to an UC or CU base pair or a CC base pair adjacent to an AA base pair.

isNoGapInSequence

public boolean isNoGapInSequence(int pos1,
                                 int pos2)
to chack if there is no gap (an unpaired nucleic acid) in the duplex between theb positions pos1 and pos2

Parameters:
int - pos1 : starting position of the subsequence in the duplex
int - pos2 : ending position of the subsequence in the duplex
Returns:

isSymmetric

public boolean isSymmetric(int pos1,
                           int pos2)
To check if the String sequence and String complementary are symmetric between the positions pos1 and pos2 in the duplex ArrayList of the NucleotidSequences object. The two sequences are symmetric if the inverse of one of them is equal to the other.

Parameters:
int - pos1 : starting position of the subduplex in the duplex ArrayList of NucleotidSequences object.
int - pos2 : ending position of the subduplex in the duplex ArrayList of NucleotidSequences object.
Returns:
true if the String sequence and the String complementary are symmetric between the positions pos1 and pos2 in the duplex.

getInternalLoopType

public java.lang.String getInternalLoopType(int pos1,
                                            int pos2)
gives the type of the internal loop at the positions pos1 + 1 and pos2 - 1 in the duplex ArrayList of the NucleotidSequences object.

Parameters:
int - pos1 : position preceding the starting position of the internal loop
int - pos2 : position following the ending position of the internal loop
Returns:
String type of the internal loop at the positions pos1 + 1 and pos2 - 1 in the duplex ArrayList. The type of the internal loop is determined by the number of nucleic acids from the sequence String which are included in the internaql loop and the number of nucleic acids from the complementary String which are included in the internaql loop Ex of type of internal loop : "1x2", "2x3", "4x4", ....

getLoopFistMismatch

public java.lang.String[] getLoopFistMismatch(int pos1)
This method is called to get the first mismatch of the internal loop at the positions pos1 + 1 and pos2 - 1 in the duplex ArrayList of the NucleotidSequences object.

Parameters:
int - pos1 : the position preceding the internal loop.
Returns:
String [] containing the first Crick's pair of the internal loop at the positions pos1 + 1 and pos2 - 1. The nucleic acids in the first base pair of the crick's pair are converted into purine or pyrimidine. this returned String [] contains the nucleic acids from the sequence String (5'3') and the nucleic acids from the complementary String (3'5'). Ex : internal loop : (ATTGCC, TGCGCG) The first Crick's pair in the loop : (AT, TG) The first msimatch in the loop : (T, G) String [] first mismatch => {RT, YG}

getSingleBulgeNeighbors

public java.lang.String[] getSingleBulgeNeighbors(int pos1)
This method is called to get the base pairs adjacent to the single bulge loop (unpaired nucleic acid) at the position pos1 in the duplex ArrayList

Parameters:
int - pos1 : position preceding the unpaired nucleic acid in the single bulge loop.
Returns:
String [] containing the nucleic acids adjacent to the bulge loop from the sequence String (5'3') and the nucleic acids adjacent to the bulge loop from the complementary String (5'3')

isAsymetricInternalLoop

public boolean isAsymetricInternalLoop(int pos1,
                                       int pos2)
to check if the internal loop between the positions pos1 + 1 and pos2 - 1 in the duplex ArrayList is asymetric. An internal loop is asymetric if one of the strands contains gap(s).

Parameters:
int - pos1 : position preceding the starting position of the internal loop
int - pos2 : position following the ending position of the internal loop
Returns:
true if the internal loop between the positions pos1 + 1 and pos2 - 1 in the duplex ArrayList is asymetric.

int - pos2 : ending position of the subsequence
hybridizationType - : type of sequence ("dna" or "rna")
Returns:
substring of the sequence String between pos1 and pos2 in the new type precised by the hybridizationType String

getSequenceSens

public java.lang.String getSequenceSens(java.lang.String sequence,
                                        int pos1,
                                        int pos2)
To get the orientation of the subsequence sequence.

Parameters:
String - sequence : a substring of sequence String or complementary String.
int - pos1 : the starting position of the substring in the sequence String or complementary String
int - pos2 : the ending position of the substring in the sequence String or complementary String
Returns:
String "5'3'" if the substring sequence is a substring of the sequence (5'3') or String "3'5'" if the substring sequence is a substring of the complementary sequence (3'5'). If the substring is neither a substring of the sequence, nor a substring of the complementary sequence a SequenceException is thrown.

getComplementaryNNPair

public java.lang.String getComplementaryNNPair(int pos)
to get the two nucleic acids which are from the complementary sequence (3'5') in the Crick's pair at the position "pos" in the duplex.

Parameters:
int - pos : position of the crick's pair in the duplex.
Returns:
a substring of the complementary String which represents the nucleic acids from the complementary sequence (3'5') in the crick'base pair at the position pos.

to get the two unlocked nucleic acids which are from the sequence (5'3') in the Crick's pair at the position "pos" in the duplex.

Parameters:
int - pos : position of the crick's pair in the duplex.
Returns:
a substring of the sequence String which represents the unlocked nucleic acids from the sequence (5'3') in the crick'base pair at the position pos.

Parameters:
int - pos : position of the crick's pair in the duplex.

a substring of the complementary String which represents the unlocked nucleic acids from the complementary sequence (3'5') in the crick'base pair at the position pos.

getNNPairWithoutHydroxyA

public java.lang.String[] getNNPairWithoutHydroxyA(int pos)
to get the two nucleic acids from each sequence in the Crick's pair at the position "pos" in the duplex. we convert the hydroxyadenine (A*) into an adenine (A).

Parameters:
int - pos : position of the crick's pair in the duplex.
Returns:
a String [] containing the substrings which represent the nucleic acids from each sequence in the crick'base pair at the position pos. The hydroxyadenine is replaced by an adenine.

calculateNumberOfTerminal

public double calculateNumberOfTerminal(java.lang.String base1,
                                        java.lang.String base2,
                                        int pos1,
                                        int pos2)
calculates the number of base pairs (base1, base2) at the postions pos1 and pos2 in the duplex ArrayList of the NucleotidSequences object

Parameters:
String - base1
String - base2
int - pos1 : starting position of the subsequence in the duplex Arraylist of the NucleotidSequences object.
int - pos2 : ending position of the subsequence in the duplex Arraylist of the NucleotidSequences object.
Returns:
int number of base pairs (base1, base2) at the postions pos1 and pos2 in the duplex ArrayList of the NucleotidSequences object

getNumberTerminal5TA

public double getNumberTerminal5TA(int pos1,
                                   int pos2)
calculates the number of terminal 5'T3'A in the subduplex between pos1 and pos2

Parameters:
int - pos1 : starting position of the subsequence in the duplex Arraylist of the NucleotidSequences object.
int - pos2 : ending position of the subsequence in the duplex Arraylist of the NucleotidSequences object.
Returns:
int number of terminal 5'T3'A in the subduplex between pos1 and pos2. 5'A/3'T means that at the position pos1, the base pair is (T,A) and at the position pos2, the base pair is (A,T).

removeTerminalUnpairedNucleotides

public int[] removeTerminalUnpairedNucleotides()
find the real starting and ending positions of the duplex. The real starting and ending positions of the duplex are the first and last positions in the duplex where the nucleic acids are paired.

Returns:
int [] containing the first and last positions in the duplex where the nucleic acids are paired.

isBasePair

public boolean isBasePair(java.lang.String base1,
                          java.lang.String base2,
                          int pos)
To check if the base pair at the position pos in the duplex is (base1, base2) or (base2, base1).

Parameters:
String - base1
String - base2
int - pos : position of the base pair in the duplex
Returns:
true if the tuple (TopAcid, BottomAcid) of the BasePair object at the position pos in the duplex ArrayList is (base1, base2) or (base2, base1).

isSelfComplementarySequence

public static boolean isSelfComplementarySequence(java.lang.String sequence)
To check if a sequence String is self complementary. A self complementary sequence is a sequence which can get bound or hybridized to itself.

Parameters:
String - sequence
Returns:
true if the sequence String is self complementary.

convertToPyr_Pur

public static java.lang.String convertToPyr_Pur(java.lang.String sequence)
converts a sequence String in a String composed of purine and pyrimidine. A and G are purines (represented by "R" in the new sequence String), C, T and U are pyrimidines (represented by "Y" in the new sequence String)

Parameters:
String - sequence to convert in purine-pyrimidine sequence.
Returns:
the new sequence String converted into a String composed of purines ("R") and pyrimidines ("Y"). If the sequence String is not only composed of - (gap), A, T, U, G and C, a SequenceExceptions is thrown.

getComplementarySequence

                                                        java.lang.String hybridization)

Parameters:
String - sequence
String - hybridization : type of hybridization
Returns:
String which represents the complementary sequence (3'5') with the specified nature.(rna, dna)

checkSequence

public static boolean checkSequence(java.lang.String sequence)
Checks if the String sequence is composed of nucleic acids known by MELTING.

Parameters:
String - sequence
Returns:
false if one of the nucleic acids is not known by MELTING. (not registered in the ArrayList existingNucleicAcids of the BasePair class). If the length of the sequence String is 0, a SequenceException is thrown.

getDanglingSens

public static java.lang.String getDanglingSens(java.lang.String seq1,
                                               java.lang.String seq2)
this method is called to get the sens of the dangling end for the sequences seq1 and seq2

Parameters:
String - seq1 : String terminal pattern of the sequence (5'3')
String - seq2 : String terminal pattern of the complementary sequence (3'5')
Returns:
String "5" if the dangling end (the unpaired nucleic acid) is a 5' dangling end and String "3" if the dangling end is a 3' dangling end. If both seq1 and seq2 contain "-", or if neither the sequence seq1 nor the sequence seq2 contains dangling ends (or gaps for the complementary sequence), a SequenceException is thrown.
